definition: easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: In this paper, a method for calculating seismic vulnerability matrix of brick masonry structure is put forward.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出一種計算磚砌體結構地震易損性矩陣的方法。

sentences.english: The algorithm has been used successfully in fighter aircraft vulnerability analysis.
sentences.chinese: 該算法可以有效地應用於飛機易損性分析計算中。

sentences.english: Conclusion The oligodendrocyte in gray matter area had selective vulnerability to ischemic injury.
sentences.chinese: 結論灰質區少突膠質細胞具有選擇性缺血易損性。

sentences.english: This research is giving us clues about the biology underlying that vulnerability.
sentences.chinese: 這項研究給了我們關於在生物方面找到易損性的線索。

sentences.english: So we get the formula of vulnerability assessment.
sentences.chinese: 據此給出了易損性評價公式。
